description: Single storey side to rear extension; installation of two AC units to rear elevation at first floor level; external alterations (demolition of side extension and conservatory)
application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
decision_conditions:
<p>The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:&nbsp;</p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;line-height:normal;mso-layout-grid-align:
none;text-autospace:none"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;"><span style="font-size: 14px;">0010/revP04, 0101/revP04, 0102/revP04, 0201/revP04, 0301/revP04,
0302/revP04, 0303/revP04, 0304/revP04, 0401/revP04, 1101/revP02, 1102/revP03,
1201/revP03, 1301/revP04, 1302/revP03, 1303/revP03, 1304/revP02, 1401/revP02, Heritage
Statement (miguel rodrigues / 27/08/2024), Detail of A/C Unit Enclosure, Noise
Impact Assessment - 19643-NIA-02 RevB Clement Acoustics,&nbsp;</span></span>Reasonable Exception Statement.&nbsp;</p>

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no windows /doors, other than those shown on the approved plans shall be installed in the flank elevations of the development hereby permitted without the prior permission in writing of the local planning authority.
The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those agreed and detailed on supporting plans (as revised).
The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the local planning authority.
